properties.areaDesc: Belknap, NH; Merrimack, NH; Rockingham, NH; Strafford, NH
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 8 at 4:25PM EST until January 8 at 5:15PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Northwestern Rockingham County in southern New Hampshire...
Northwestern Strafford County in central New Hampshire...
Belknap County in central New Hampshire...
Merrimack County in central New Hampshire...

* Until 515 PM EST.

* At 425 PM EST, a line of dangerous snow squalls were located along
a line extending from near Gilmanton to near Hopkinton, moving
east, southeast at 40 mph. Snow may melt on road surfaces and
refreeze after sunset.

HAZARD...Snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 89 between mile markers 0 and 5.
Interstate 93 between mile markers 29 and 74.

This also includes...
Mount Kearsage.

Locations impacted include...
Concord, Laconia, Franklin, New London, Meredith, Northwood,
Hooksett, Farmington, Hopkinton, Loudon, Alton, Barnstead, Epsom,
Gilmanton, Canterbury, Holderness, Ashland, Danbury, Warner and Bow.
properties.instruction:
Travel is not advised during this dangerous snow squall.  Rapid
visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to lead to
accidents.  Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your
location.  If traveling, pull off to a safe location and turn your
headlights on.

Temperatures are above freezing, but sharply colder temperatures
following the snow will cause any water or slush to quickly freeze on
roads and sidewalks.  Untreated road surfaces will become extremely
slippery.  Reduced speeds and increased distance between vechicles is
advised.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 5:15 PM EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
